data.title: Ethereum Attestation Service
data.description:
**Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS)** is an infrastructure public good for making attestations onchain or offchain about anything. **Open-source**, **permissionless**, **token-free**. Built by the community for the community. Live on mainnet, several L2s, & testnets.

> **Attestations are digital signatures on structured data used to build more trust online & onchain.**

How do you decide who and what to trust? Our online and onchain worlds are filled with both genuine and deceptive information. We need a common way we can trust the authenticity of information and the safety of our interactions. Anytime you need to prove or verify something, attestations will play a critical role. Learn more about [why we exist](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/purpose/eas-purpose).

## How It Works
EAS runs on [two smart contracts](https://github.com/ethereum-attestation-service) — one for registering a schema and the other for making attestations with schemas. We've also created several dev tools to help builders build faster:

- An [attestation explorer](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/easscan/overview) to discover and create schemas + attestations
- [EAS SDK](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/developer-tools/eas-sdk) to easily start building
- [GraphQL API](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/developer-tools/api) for each chain
- [Endless Docs](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/welcome) for technical & non-technical builders

## Who Uses It
We've already seen a few amazing use cases from the community such as:

- [Gitcoin Passport](https://optimism.easscan.org/schema/view/0x6ab5d34260fca0cfcf0e76e96d439cace6aa7c3c019d7c4580ed52c6845e9c89) stamps & scores can be attested to onchain
- [Optimism RetroPGF](https://optimism.easscan.org/schema/view/0xebbf697d5d3ca4b53579917ffc3597fb8d1a85b8c6ca10ec10039709903b9277) applications & approvals are attestations (EAS is natively integrated into the OP Stack)
- [Coinbase](https://base.easscan.org/address/0x357458739F90461b99789350868CD7CF330Dd7EE) attesting to verified accounts
- [Devfolio's](https://arbitrum.easscan.org/schema/view/0x951fa7e07d6e852eb4535331db373786f5ab7249bb31d94cc4bd05250ebb6500) quadratic voting for hackathons
- [Guild](https://x.com/guildxyz/status/1699085302281671124?s=20) using attestations to gate communities & chat groups
- and many more...

Check out some of the [Gitcoin Passport Score](https://optimism.easscan.org/schema/view/0x6ab5d34260fca0cfcf0e76e96d439cace6aa7c3c019d7c4580ed52c6845e9c89) attestations coming in.
![Gitcoin Passport Score Attestations](https://docs.attest.sh/assets/images/explorer-landing-a0b436a39afc04734034e3c8ee396ce3.png)

## What We're Excited About
- [The Vision](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/purpose/the-vision)
- The diversity in projects people are building with EAS (identity and beyond)
- The impact attestations will make on public goods funding strategies and decentralized governance
- Sybil resistance use cases 
- Attesting to the authenticity of content
- Machine to machine attestations
- more [ideas to build](https://docs.attest.sh/docs/category/ideas-to-build)

## Where We're Focused
- We're actively building out improvements to the attestation explorer experience
- Continued builder education, awareness, and adoption
- Building unique integrations such as (zkps generated from attestations)

## Get In Touch With Us & Check Out Some Community Content

Community Content:
- [Ethereum Attestation Service - Unlocking Decentralized Identity - Bankless Podcast](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RsIBqExwsT8)
- [Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS) - Explainer Video - Vaibhav Saini](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8bbkI5MIWm8&)
- [ELI5 Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS) - Why You Should Care - Ryan Yi](https://mirror.xyz/ryanyyi.eth/Q0NMTOpazMUeXuifPmxebxnyVJuUExEH7K8Qbu7HLy0)
- [Onchain Attestation Stats - Dune Dashboard - Ryan Yi](https://dune.com/ryanyyi/eas)

EAS Channels:
- [EAS Twitter (@eas_eth)](https://twitter.com/eas_eth)
- [Mirror Articles](https://mirror.xyz/0xeee68aECeB4A9e9f328a46c39F50d83fA0239cDF)
- [Builder Telegram](https://t.me/+EcynOr0iFu03MTYx)
- [EAS GitHub](https://github.com/ethereum-attestation-service)

answers.question: Link to your Public Group Chat (Discord or Telegram )
How is your project in support of or directly advancing the Ethereum Network’s infrastructure?
answers.answer:
EAS is an open-source standard and base layer where any entity can make attestations about anything. This primitive ledger for registering schemas and making attestations will help us decentralize more than just money and assets.

Attested and composable data is a massive unlock. It's enabling builders throughout to ecosystem to explore reputation systems, voting systems, governance systems, decentralized social media, the provenance of goods + knowledge, build social graphs, and much much more.

answers.question: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you haven’t participated previously).
answers.answer:
Since the last round, we've made additional updates to the Attestation Explorer that allow creators to easily attest to the names, descriptions, and context of their attestations and deployed on Polygon Tesnets.

We've also deployed a new contract for indexing attestations called the "indexer.sol" contract in our repo.

Additionally, we continue to educate and support builders who are exploring & integrating EAS.

answers.question: How do you measure the impact of your project? Please provide examples and/or standard metrics. This might be used in future impact reports
answers.answer: We're looking at developer activation and general usage of the protocol. We just crossed over 100k attestations on mainnet deployments + testnets. There's been over 9,000+ attesters and 1k+ schemas created.

Would you like to opt-in to future messages from Gitcoin for updates, information, and/or interviews?
